description: From Middle English bejapen, bijapen, equivalent to be- +‎ jape. Cognate with Scots bejaip (“to befool”).

verbs.description: bejape (third-person singular simple present bejapes, present participle bejaping, simple past and past participle bejaped)

entries.meaning: (transitive, rare, UK dialectal) To play a trick on; trick or befool.
